alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 12:19PM PDT until August 20 at 2:30PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN SAN DIEGO COUNTY... At 1219 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated gages indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.25 inches of rain per hour have fallen over Mt Laguna. Additional hourly rainfall rates of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible over the eastern slopes of the mountains. Elsewhere in the warned area, hourly rates of 0.50 to 0.75 inch is expected. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gages. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southeastern Mount Laguna, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, I-8 Between Boulevard And Imperial County Line, Hwy S2 Between Agua Caliente And Canebrake, Hwy S2 Between Canebrake And Imperial County Line, Hwy S2 Vallecito Creek Rd, Fish Creek Wash, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Boulevard and Ocotillo Wells. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
